stories.text:
Hi HN! I am currently thinking about careers and computer science seems like an interesting field.

I understand that computers will be here for a while, but will there be a need for Computer Programmers in the near future? Also is the computer science field saturated? Lastly, is this a viable field?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is computer science a viable field?
To Fix California's Housing Crisis, Look to the Duplex
Lawyer Accuses Johnny Depp of Being “Obsessed” with Elon Musk
The bad behavior of the richest: what I learned from wealth managers (2018)
The Chinese Cartoon That Beat the Censors

stories.text:
Recently I've gotten more and more curious about the idea of using music (listening to or making it) as a therapeutic tool, in the most general sense.

Now I don't really mean the music we play nonstop in the background. I mean it in a more deliberate way, like a practice/ritual done regularly because you really notice the positive effects it has in your life.

What genre and/or artists work best for you? Do you listen to different things for particular purposes/situations? Do you listen with headphones or on stereo? Do you do other things while listening, or do you focus your attention solely on the music? Any other patterns you've observed?

And if you make music, are there particular aspects that are more therapeutic than others?
stories.title: Ask HN: Music as Therapy?
Magnetizing an Atomic Gas with Light
Do Your Marketing Metrics Show You the Full Picture?

stories.text:
I'll be honest, I used to get so excited by web development when I was still a teenager. I would spend hours building websites in PHP, learning HTML, hacking vBulletin forums, copying and pasting code from tutorials online.

15 years later and I actually work as a web developer, and frankly, the work is becoming a bit stale. I've probably spent too long working on the same sorts of things: Laravel, WordPress plugins, CRUD stuff mostly. But really, I think part of the joy has disappeared because it's become something I rely on for my income, rather than a passion.

I'd like to re-capture the joy I used to feel when I first started coding.

Web devs: what excites you about web development at the moment? I'd like to hear the frameworks, languages, projects or dreams you have that energise you.
stories.title: Ask HN: What excites you about web development at the moment?
